wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Dalberg (7 January 1907 – 9 May 1988) was an English-born South African opera bass. As an ensemble member of the Leipzig Opera, Bavarian State Opera, Covent Garden and Mannheim National Theatre, he excelled in German romantic operas, especially those by Richard Wagner, but also took part in several premieres of contemporary compositions.

response: * Frederick Dalrymple (1907-1988), birth name of Frederick Dalberg, English born South African opera singer

Parallel to her stage performances, she was a concert singer. She sang, for example, under the direction of Fritz Busch, Wilhelm Furtwängler and Richard Strauss. During her career, the singer did not appear in the studio. However, a recording of a Bayreuth Meistersinger performance from 1943, in which she sings Magdalene, was released on HMV-Electrola in 1976. Her partners were Paul Schöffler, Ludwig Suthaus, Erich Kunz, Frederick Dalberg, Erich Witte and Hilde Scheppan, and the Bayreuth Festival choir and orchestra sang and played under Hermann Abendroth.Bayreuth 1942 on bayern-online
